intro: Hieracium murorum var. sagittatum, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and yellowish to reddish flower heads. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas, where it spreads through its rhizomatous growth system.
